intro: Erigeron canadensis f. coloratus, commonly known as the showy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy blue to purple ray flowers surrounding a central disk of yellow florets, making it visually striking. It typically grows in open fields, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in full sun. Its foliage is usually gray-green with hairy surfaces, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
